org.letras.psi.iregion
Class RegionSample

java.lang.Object
  org.letras.psi.iregion.RegionSample
All Implemented Interfaces:
RegionMessage
public class RegionSample
extends java.lang.Object
implements RegionMessage

After the region processing stage, the information of the position in the global coordinate system given in Pattern Space Coordinates (PSC) alone does not suffice anymore. Therefore, the x and y coordinates of a RegionSample are represented in Normalized Region Coordinates (NRC), that is: x and y hold values ranging from 0.0 to 1.0, which indicate the normalized coordinate to the interested enclosing regions bounding box. The term interested here refers to a situation, where a hungry region might consume samples of their children. In such a case, the x and y coordinates of the samples streamed to the parent region will differ from those streamed to the children, while the PSC coordinates would be the same. In order to allow an unique identification of a sample, the PSC coordinates are included also.

Version:
0.1
Author:
felix_h

Constructor Detail

RegionSample

public RegionSample()
No-argument constructor for serialization. Note that this constructor does not initialize the class members with meaningful values. It should be used by the serialization mechanism ONLY, use the constructor taking values for the class members instead.

RegionSample

public RegionSample(double x,
                    double y,
                    double pscX,
                    double pscY,
                    int force,
                    long timestamp,
                    java.lang.String penId)
Constructor taking all enclosed data explicitly. Note that when using this constructor, the Caller takes responsibility, for providing the coordinates (both PSC and NRC) correctly.

Parameters:
x - x coordinate of the sample (in NRC)
y - y coordinate of the sample (in NRC)
pscX - x coordinate of the sample (in PSC)
pscY - y coordinate of the sample (in PSC)
force - force of the sample
timestamp - time-stamp of the sample

RegionSample

public RegionSample(PenSample ps,
                    Bounds regionBounds,
                    java.lang.String penId)
Constructor creating a RegionSample out of the data represented in the provided PenSample and its enclosing regions bound (in form of an Bounds).

Parameters:
ps - the PenSample containing the data to be enclosed by the RegionSample
regionBounds - the Bounds of an enclosing IRegions IShape

Specified by:
accept in interface RegionMessage

normalizeCoordinates

protected void normalizeCoordinates(double xr,
                                    double yr,
                                    double wr,
                                    double hr)
Normalize this samples x and y coordinates to the rectangular region specified (compute normalized region coordinates).

Precondition: The PSC coordinates of this sample must be set to meaningful values and the sample lies within the rectangle specified by the provided parameters
Postcondition: The x and y coordinates of this region will be initialized to the normalized region coordinates of the provided rectangle

Parameters:
xr - absolute x position of the region (in PSC)
yr - absolute y position of the region (in PSC)
wr - relative width of the region (in PSC)
hr - relative height of the region (in PSC)

public java.lang.String toString()
